Issues.Title: Mdicontainer iconchanges
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #4621


## Proposed changes

- The visibility of the Icon in the MDIControlStrip is dependent on the ShowIcon property on the target MDI child.
- When the icon gets updated in the target MDI child, the icon gets updated in the MDIControlStrip and its visibility is checked.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The icon will now change dependent on ShowIcon and the icon in the target MDI child.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Icon can not be used to open context menu when icon is hidden.

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

With showicon = false and the icon set to error icon after it is maximized.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/155535/110207129-c66f5c80-7e81-11eb-94f2-a93c6bb3c01d.png)

### After

the icon set to error icon after it is maximized.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/155535/110207294-db98bb00-7e82-11eb-8be3-da652464e89e.png)

With showicon = false
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/155535/110207319-f834f300-7e82-11eb-83e0-04ca92fb7dcb.png)



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- manual testing
- Unit test 

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->

Issues.Title: When form icon is used, form.resx throws an error
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.2 SDK

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
 No
**Problem description:**
If new form is created and Icon is set in properties, then the form resx throws an error: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. Ico files was used.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3244218/110341906-85b74500-8033-11eb-970f-20decd7b1469.png)

**Expected behavior:**
resx file should be usable in visual studio after setting icon to form.

**Minimal repro:**
1. Add new windows form to project (.NET SDK 5.0.2, Visual studio Version 16.9.0).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3244218/110342473-1aba3e00-8034-11eb-8a5f-2c05880bbda0.png)
2.  and add icon to form.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3244218/110342523-2d347780-8034-11eb-9355-08a5bf7b96c7.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When form icon is used, form.resx throws an error" (#4661)

Issues.Title: Enable double buffering by default for all forms and controls
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
<!--
    A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
  -->
If I make an app and forget to turn on double buffering in my forms and controls, rendering can be laggy, especially if I handle the Paint event to do GDI rendering.

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**
<!--
    A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. This includes:
    - Description of what API need to be added or changed.
    - Code that shows the surface area of the API.
    - Code that shows real world scenarios, and how they would otherwise be handled.
    - Details showing the usage/consumption of the proposed new API, and alternatives (e.g. not having this API).
    - Any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

    :exclamation: Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md for more details

  -->

The DoubleBuffered property should default to true instead of false on all forms and controls.

There might be some downside to this but I'm not aware of it.


**Will this feature affect UI controls?**
<!--
    Yes / No

    If yes, describe the following:

        - Will VS Designer need to support the feature? If yes, describe how you expect it to funсtion.
        - What impact will it have on accessibility?
        - Will this feature need to be localized or be localizable?
  -->
Yes, this will impact UI controls.
There should be no change to the designer; I'm pretty sure it's smart enough to deal with changes to default values of properties already.
There should be no impact on accessibility.
There is no need for localization.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enable double buffering by default for all forms and controls" (#4654)

Issues.Title: A proposal to rework bolded dates collections to HashSet in MonthCalendar
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->
I propose to change type of `_arrayOfDates`, `_annualArrayOfDates`, `_monthlyArrayOfDates` collections from `List` to `HashSet` in `MonthCalendar` to improve performance and clean up the code.
This change allows to make the implementation more logical and avoid extra checks of containing items. 

**User impact**
- Due to `HashSet` can't store duplicates of items, our collections will store only unique dates. So, if a user set some array with duplicate items to `BoldedDates` property, `HashSet` remove duplicates, and `getter` of `BoldedDates` property will return lesser collection to the user. This returned collection will be different from the initial user array.
But it looks logical to me, because we shouldn't store and show duplicate dates. **But we need to discuss any cases when we must store duplicate dates.**

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**
- No

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
- No
<!--
    A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
  -->

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**
- Change type of `_arrayOfDates`, `_annualArrayOfDates`, `_monthlyArrayOfDates` collections from `List` to `HashSet` in `MonthCalendar`
- Rework related properties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A proposal to rework bolded dates collections to HashSet in MonthCalendar" (#4647)

Issues.Title: Several tests fail due to culture being nl-BE
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* WinForms Version: 
The main branch of the Winforms Repository

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
N/A

**Problem description:**
Multiple tests fail due to the fact that the culture is different. 
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.LinkAreaConverterTests.LinkAreaConverter_ConvertFrom_InvalidString_ThrowsArgumentException(value: "1,2,3")
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.LinkAreaConverterTests.LinkAreaConverter_ConvertFrom_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.LinkAreaConverterTests.LinkAreaConverter_ConvertTo_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.LinkConverterTests.LinkConverter_ConvertFrom_InvalidString_ThrowsArgumentException(value: "1,2,3")
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.LinkConverterTests.LinkConverter_ConvertFrom_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.LinkConverterTests.LinkConverter_ConvertTo_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.OpacityConverterTests.OpacityConverter_ConvertFrom_InvalidString_ThrowsFormatException
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.OpacityConverterTests.OpacityConverter_ConvertFrom_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.PaddingConverterTests.PaddingConverter_ConvertFrom_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.PaddingConverterTests.PaddingConverter_ConvertTo_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.TableLayoutPanelCellPositionTests.TableLayoutPanelCellPosition_ConverterConvertFrom_InvalidColumn_ThrowsArgumentOutOfRangeException
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.TableLayoutPanelCellPositionTests.TableLayoutPanelCellPosition_ConverterConvertFrom_InvalidRow_ThrowsArgumentOutOfRangeException
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.TableLayoutPanelCellPositionTests.TableLayoutPanelCellPosition_ConverterConvertFrom_String_ReturnsExpected
- System.Windows.Forms.Tests.WebBrowserTests.WebBrowser_StatusText_GetWithDocument_ReturnsExpected


**Expected behavior:**
- They should work even if the default culture of a user is different. 

**Minimal repro:**
- Set cultureinfo to nl-BE
- run the tests in

Issues.Title: Implement InitialDirectory and ClientGuid for FolderBrowserDialog
Issues.Body:
Resolves #3512

## Proposed changes

- Add `InitialDirectory` and `ClientGuid` to `FolderBrowserDialog` to match what `FileDialog` already has

## Customer Impact

- bring the modern (aka Vista) FolderBrowserDialog to parity with FileDialog
- as a side effect, also respect the initial directory for the classic folder dialog, by expanding the directory without selecting it
  - this is done for consistency, so that when future code is written to only set `InitialDirectory` it still works out of the box when the modern dialog is not available, which has been reported a while ago for some server machine setups that were still supported.

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- manual testing
- API tests matching those for `FileDialog`

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

none required, the dialog already existed, the additional configuration options do not expose new elements to accessibility

Issues.Title: ToolStripProfessionalRenderer has hardcoded value where a configurable property should be respected
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version:  5.0.3
<!-- e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info` -->

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes
<!-- Yes / No -->

**Problem description:**
Add a new StatusStrip to a Form. Now create a descendant of ProfessionalColorTable and feed that into the constructor of a descendant of ToolStripProfessionalRenderer. Set this renderer as the renderer of the StatusStrip. Now the StatusStrip has an unconfigurable border because it is hard coded into the framework.



**Expected behavior:**
Either respect the Color specified in ToolStripBorder in the ProfessionalColorTable or add a new virtual property StatusStripBorder. Option 2 would be preferred.

**Minimal repro:**
The following line is directly taken from the .NET Core source code of ToolstripProfessionalRenderer.cs. Notice the hardcoded value "SystemPens.ButtonHighlight". This is bad.

private void RenderStatusStripBorder(ToolStripRenderEventArgs e)
{
    e.Graphics.DrawLine(SystemPens.ButtonHighlight, 0, 0, e.ToolStrip.Width, 0);
}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ToolStripProfessionalRenderer has hardcoded value where a configurable property should be respected" (#4643)

Issues.Title: When I open the WinForms designer in a certain project, it freezes for 10 minutes before finally loading.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
<!-- e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info` -->
5.0

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
<!-- Yes / No -->
No

**Problem description:**

<!--
    Describe the current behavior, what is wrong or not working as expected.
    Provide as much information as possible, including callstack for crashes/exceptions, screenshots or animations.
  -->
When I load the Windows Forms designer for any form in my FrEee game, Visual Studio freezes for a few minutes before finally loading the designer.

I thought it was an issue with my screen scaling setting (I recently upgraded to a 4K monitor, and bumped up the scaling from 100% to 175%). However reducing the scaling back to 100% did not help.

I also tried disabling a bunch of Visual Studio extensions, but that didn't help either.

Now I'm thinking Visual Studio is trying to load a .NET Framework 4 version of WinForms for whatever reason and failing (I also recently upgraded the project to .NET 5), but that failed load is taking several minutes. But I'm not entirely sure. The reason I say that is because one time I got an error message with a link to an XML log file which had timestamped entries, and there was one that was 10 minutes or so after the previous one that mentioned .NET Framework 4 and WinForms...

See this Visual Studio bug report for more details:
https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/when-i-try-to-open-the-windows-forms-designer-visu/1331179


**Expected behavior:**

The designer should load in a matter of seconds, not minutes.


**Minimal repro:**

Don't have one but i do have this repo which contains the project that was failing: https://github.com/ekolis/FrEee
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When I open the WinForms designer in a certain project, it freezes for 10 minutes before finally loading." (#4641)

Issues.Title: Fixes #4558
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4558 

## Proposed changes

- Use the center of a ListViewItem to get the correct item back. The x & y coordinates get recalculated in `ListView.FindNearestItem(SearchDirectionHint, int, int)` anyways.

## Customer Impact

None

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

The items returned by FindNearestItem could be wrong in a different way than it is now.

## Test methodology 

- I've written a unit test.

Issues.Title: DGV throws `IndexOutOfRangeException` whenever its datasource is disposed (servicing)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #4216


## Proposed changes

- Add Dispose event handlers to clear DataSource of DGV and BindingSource of BindingNavigator thereby update their data source actual state

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- A user won't catch the exception when closing a form or disposing a BindingSource

## Regression? 

- Yes and no. .NET Framework 4.8 throws an exception when closing a form. v.4.7 doesn't throw the exception in this case. But anyway every version throws the exception if to Dispose a BindingSource component

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
- A DataGridView doesn't update its Rows and Columns collections after its DataSource is disposed. And the DGV throws the exception when trying to redraw because the DGV is trying to draw items from a DataSource that doesn't already exist (send some index, eg. 4, to the collection that has 0 items, and catch IndexOutOfRangeException)
![vR6xyN1oe6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/107550604-49cec280-6be2-11eb-848d-d137900e1a07.gif)

<!-- TODO -->

### After
- `DataGridView` and `BindingNavigator` subscribed on the `BindingSource.Disposed` event and release their `DataSource` and `BindingSource` to update internal collections
![mtA3PmfUl4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/107550667-5d7a2900-6be2-11eb-8299-757cc49e73af.gif)

<!-- TODO -->


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Unit testing
- Manual UI testing
- CTI

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 6.0.100-preview.1.21101.5
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19042.804]


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: An exception was throwing when switching the dates of MonthCalendar control on .NET 6.0 windows arm64 SDK
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.NET SDK 6.0.100-preview.3.21123.4

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More info:**
1. This issue **cannot** reproduce on .NET 6.0 Windows x64 SDK build
2. This issue can reproduce from .NET 6.0 Preview 1 to Preview 3 windows arm64 SDK latest build
2. This issue cannot reproduce on DateTimePicker control

**Minimal repro:**
[TestApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/6067569/TestApp.zip)

1. Install .NET 6.0 windows arm64 SDK latest build from: https://github.com/dotnet/installer on ARM 64-bit OS machine
2. Create a Winforms Core application with a MonthCalendar control
3. Build and run this project, then switch dates of MonthCalendar

**Actual behavior:**
An exception was throwing when switching dates of MonthCalendar.
![Core](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/109626225-3e384100-7b7b-11eb-9d68-6e7dcf26a6f5.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
The dates switched successfully.

**Call Stack:**
************** Exception Text **************
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Hour, Minute, and Second parameters describe an un-representable DateTime.
   at System.Windows.Forms.DateTimePicker.SysTimeToDateTime(SYSTEMTIME s)
   at System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.GetMonthRange(GMR flag)
   at System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.BoldDates(DateBoldEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.WmDateBold(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.WmReflectCommand(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, WM msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An exception was throwing when switching the dates of MonthCalendar control on .NET 6.0 windows arm64 SDK" (#4629)
